result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin K. Lobermeier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.

records.addlTxt:
3:58 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Kevin K. Lobermeier not in court, Attorney David Vernon Penn appeared by video for Kevin K. Lobermeier. Penn has received information and enters not guilty pleas. Court states Defendant can appear by Zoom if in treatment. Bond continued. adj. 04:01 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Must reside with mother Gail Lobermeier at 1112 Old Oak Ln, Woodruff, WI 54568

1:38 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Kevin K. Lobermeier appeared by video, in custody, Attorney David Vernon Penn appeared by video for Kevin K. Lobermeier. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - waives preliminary hearing - waiver free and voluntary. Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Schiek would like set for a separate arraignment date. Penn/Schiek statement to bond. Defendant not on a PO hold - provides address. Court sets bond. 01:47 PM
Arraignment scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:17 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Kevin K. Lobermeier appeared by video. Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek appearing by video. Svehlek appears specially - attorney David Penn may take appointment. Court will set out. Bond continued. adj. 01:19 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 27, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

1:25 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Kevin K. Lobermeier appeared by video, in custody. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Schiek statement to bail. Court sets bond. adj. 01:28 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
